trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account is associated with a Reserved Unit Type which determines the speed with which your encoding jobs are processed.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account is associated with a Reserved Unit Type which determines the speed with which your encoding jobs are processed.

trans-unit.source: You can pick between the following reserved unit types: Basic, Standard, or Premium.
trans-unit.target: You can pick between the following reserved unit types: Basic, Standard, or Premium.

trans-unit.source: For example, the same encoding job runs faster when you use the Standard reserved unit type compare to the Basic type.
trans-unit.target: For example, the same encoding job runs faster when you use the Standard reserved unit type compare to the Basic type.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the "Encoding Reserved Unit Types" blog written by [Milan Gada](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/author/milanga/).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the "Encoding Reserved Unit Types" blog written by [Milan Gada](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/author/milanga/).

trans-unit.source: In addition to specifying the reserved unit type, you can specify to provision your account with encoding reserved units.
trans-unit.target: In addition to specifying the reserved unit type, you can specify to provision your account with encoding reserved units.

trans-unit.source: The number of provisioned encoding reserved units determines the number of media tasks that can be processed concurrently in a given account.
trans-unit.target: The number of provisioned encoding reserved units determines the number of media tasks that can be processed concurrently in a given account.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your account has 5 reserved units, then 5 media tasks will be running concurrently as long as there are tasks to be processed.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your account has 5 reserved units, then 5 media tasks will be running concurrently as long as there are tasks to be processed.

trans-unit.source: The remaining tasks will wait in the queue and will get picked up for processing sequentially as soon as a running task finishes.
trans-unit.target: The remaining tasks will wait in the queue and will get picked up for processing sequentially as soon as a running task finishes.

trans-unit.source: If an account does not have any reserved units provisioned, then tasks will be picked up sequentially.
trans-unit.target: If an account does not have any reserved units provisioned, then tasks will be picked up sequentially.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the wait time between one task finishing and the next one starting will depend on the availability of resources in the system.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the wait time between one task finishing and the next one starting will depend on the availability of resources in the system.

trans-unit.source: To change the reserved unit type and the number of encoding reserved units using .NET SDK, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To change the reserved unit type and the number of encoding reserved units using .NET SDK, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Opening a Support Ticket
trans-unit.target: Opening a Support Ticket

trans-unit.source: By default every Media Services account can scale to up to 25 Encoding and 5 On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units.
trans-unit.target: By default every Media Services account can scale to up to 25 Encoding and 5 On-Demand Streaming Reserved Units.

trans-unit.source: You can request a higher limit by opening a support ticket.
trans-unit.target: You can request a higher limit by opening a support ticket.

trans-unit.source: Open a support ticket
trans-unit.target: Open a support ticket

trans-unit.source: To open a support ticket do the following:
trans-unit.target: To open a support ticket do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click [Get Support](https://manage.windowsazure.com/?getsupport=true).
trans-unit.target: Click [Get Support](https://manage.windowsazure.com/?getsupport=true).

trans-unit.source: If you are not logged in, you will be prompted to enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: If you are not logged in, you will be prompted to enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: Select your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Select your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Under support type, select "Technical".
trans-unit.target: Under support type, select "Technical".

trans-unit.source: Click on "Create Ticket".
trans-unit.target: Click on "Create Ticket".

trans-unit.source: Select "Azure Media Services" in the product list presented on the next page.
trans-unit.target: Select "Azure Media Services" in the product list presented on the next page.

trans-unit.source: Select a "Problem type" that is appropriate for your issue.
trans-unit.target: Select a "Problem type" that is appropriate for your issue.

trans-unit.source: Click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions on next page and then enter details about your issue.
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions on next page and then enter details about your issue.

trans-unit.source: Click submit to open the ticket.
trans-unit.target: Click submit to open the ticket.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
